titleStmt.title: Tamiḻneṟi Viḷakkam 14.
Experimenting with formatting for the final edition.

witness.expan: A Critical Edition and Study of Akapporul Vilakkam [ante correctionem]
A Critical Edition and Study of Akapporul Vilakkam [post correctionem]

div.p: Amongst the eight [types of] marriage mentioned by those prior theoreticians, the kaniruvam custom is called kaḷavu
e-tu. kaikōḷ iraṇṭiṉ uḷḷuṅ kaḷavoḻukkām āṟuṇarttutaṉutaliṟṟu.
The quoted [cūttiram] intends to make known the way in which, of the two [which form] kaikōḷ, the kaḷavu conduct occurs.
toṉ ṉūl āciriyarkaḷāṟ collap paṭṭa vaṟanilai yoppu poruḷ kōṭeyvam arum poruḷ vali nilai pēy nilai kantiruvam eṉap paṭṭa maṇam eṭṭiṉ uḷḷuṅ kantiruva vaḻakkam pōlvatu kaḷavoḻukkam ām eṉṟa vāṟu.

aṟanilai, oppu, poruḷ kōḷ, teyvam, arum poruḷ, vali nilai, pēy nilai, kantiruvam which are [all] mentioned by the teachers of the old treatises - amongst those eight [types of] marriage, the kantiruvam custom is the same as the kaḷavu conduct.
aṟanilai yāvatu nāṟpatteṭṭiyāṇṭu piramacariyaṅ kāttāṟkup paṉṉīrāṭṭaip pirāyattāḷai yaṇikalam aṇintu koṭuppatu. iḵtoppil kūṭṭam ātaliṟ poruntāk kāmattiṉ pāṟ paṭum

As for aṟanilai, to a protector who is a 48 year old brahmacharya, a 12 year old girl is given after being decorated with ornaments. This falls to the side of unsuitable love because this union is unequal.
oppāvatu maittuṉak kōttirattāṟku māṟṟātu koṭuppatu. itu kaṟpiṉ pāṟ paṭum.
As for oppu, [it is] the giving [of the bride] without refusal to the kōttiram of one’s maternal cousin. This falls to the side of kaṟpu.
poruḷ kōḷ āvatu āṉum āṉ ēṟum poṟ kōṭṭup poṟ kuḷam piṉavākac ceyvataṟṟōṭu nīriṟ koṭuppatu. ivvāṟōtaṟkaṇ otta pirāya mutal āyiṉ avaṟṟuḷaveṉiṟ kaṟpiṉ pāṟ paṭum; aṉṟeṉiṟ poruntāk kāmattiṉ pāṟ paṭum
teyvam āvatu vēḷvi yāciriyaṟku vēḷvit tī muṉṉar koṭuppatu. ituvum poruḷ kōḷōṭokkum
As for teyvam, [it is] the giving [of the bride] to the sacrificial priest before the sacrificial fire. This too is the same as poruḷ kōḷ.
arum poruḷ viṉai yāvatu kol lēṟu taḻuvutal vil lēṟṟu mutalaṉa ceytārkkuk koṭuppatu. itu vaṉ maṇam ātaliṟ poruntāk kāmattiṉ pāṟ paṭum.

As for arum poruḷ viṉai, [it is] the giving [of the bride] to the one who does the actions of embracing the murderous bull, bowmanship etc. This falls to the side of unsuitable love because this is a forced marriage.
vali nilai yāvatu tamariṉum avaḷiṉum peṟātu valintu koḷvatu. ituvum ataṉ pāṟ paṭum.
As for vali nilai, [it is] the forceful taking without obtaining [permission] from either her relations or her. This also falls to that side [of being a forced marriage].
pēy nilai yāvatu kaḷittāṇ māṭṭun tuyiṉṟāṇ māṭṭuñ celvatu. ituvum poruntāk kāmattiṉ pāṟ paṭum.
As for pēy nilai, [it is] the going [off with the bride] when she is intoxicated or sleeping. This too falls to the side of unsuitable love.
kantiruvam āvatu ottār iruvar tāmē kaḷaviṉāṟ kūṭuṅ kūṭṭam.

itaṉāl oruvāṟaṟamuṉ ākiya voppumai yuṭaittēṉum āṇ mutalākac collap paṭṭa kaḷavoḻukkan teyvap puṇarcciyum pāṅkaṟ kūṭṭamun tōḻiyiṟ kūṭṭattup pakaṟ kuṟiyum iravuk kuṟiyum varaivu kaṭātalum uṭaṉ pōkku valittalum eṉa vāṟām eṉra vāṟu. 14.

standOff.note: Cf. IA1: aṉpi ṉaintiṇaik kaḷaveṉap paṭuva / tantaṇa rarumaṟai maṉṟa leṭṭaṉuṭ / kantaruva vaḻukka meṉmaṉār pulavar//
Cf. TP89i:...kāmak kūṭṭaṅ kāṇuṅ kālai / maṟaiyōr tēettu maṉṟa leṭṭaṉuṭ / ṭuṟaiyamai nalyāḻt tuṇaimaiyō riyalpē//

Cf. IAC1, p.31: aṟanilai yoppē poruḷkō ṭeyvam/ yāḻōr kūṭṭa marumporuḷ viṉaiyē/ yākkatam pēynilai yeṉṟik kūṟiya/ maṟaiyōr maṉṟa leṭṭivai yavaṟṟuṭ/ ṭuṟaiyamai nalliyāḻt tuṇaimaiyō riyalpitaṉ/ poruṇmai yeṉmaṉār pulamai yōrē//

This anonymous verse is the earliest known enumeration of the 'Tamil' terms for the aṣṭavivāha . It may be that this list is based on the Gautama Dharmasūtra, which shares the same order of the enumeration (Wilden 2021). It is also quoted in Iḷampūraṇar's commentary to the first cūttiram of the Kaḷaviyal (TP89i). In essence, these names are really descriptions of the main characteristc of the marriage rite being performed. The other early enumeration we find for the eight types of marriage is in the commentary to the IAC, immediately following the above quoted verse. In this, Nakkīraṉār gives a correspondence between the Tamilised Sanskrit names of the types of marriage which are the class of being for whom each type of marriage is suitable. For whatever reason, this treatise and commentary both choose the Sanskritic name for the marriage most appropriate for kaḷavu poetry - 'kantiruvam (Skt. Gāndharva) - as opposed to the Tamil term - nalyāḻt tuṇaimai ('companionship of those with the good lutes' i.e. the Gāndharvas). For a more detalied analysis and explanation of the transmission of the aṣṭavivāha, see Wilden 2021.

Cf. IAC1, p.31: piramam eṉpatu nāṟpat teṭṭiyāṇṭu piramacariyaṅ kāttāṟkup paṉṉīrāṭṭaip pirāyattāḷai aṇikalaṉaṇintu koṭuppatu. koṭāviṭiṉ, orirutukkāḷci oruvaṉaic cārātu kaḻinta viṭattu oru pārppaṉakkālaiyōṭu okku meṉpatu; ataṉai aṟanilaiyeṉpatu
Cf. Gaut 4.6: brāhmo vidyācāritrabandhuśīlasaṃpannāya dadyādācchādyālaṃkṛtām
Cf. IAC1, p.31: piracāpattiyam eṉpatu maittuṉa kōttirattāṉ makaḷvēṇṭic ceṉṟāl maṟātu koṭuppatu; ataṉai oppeṉpatu
Cf. Gaut 4.7: saṃyogamantraḥ prājāpatye saha dharmaś caryatām iti
Cf. IAC1, p.31-2: āriṭam eṉpatu āvum āṉēṟum poṟkōṭṭup poṟkuḷampiṉavākac ceytu avaṟṟiṭai nīriṟkoṭuppatu; ataṉai poruḷkōḷeṉpatu
Cf. Gaut 4.8: ārṣe gomithunaṃ kanyāvate dadyāt
Cf. IAC1, p.32: teyvam eṉpatu, vēḷviyāciriyaṟku vēḷvittīmuṉ vaittuk koṭuppatu; ataṉai teyvameṉru vaḻipaṭappaṭṭatu
Cf. Gaut 4.9: antarvedyṛtvije dānaṃ daivo 'laṃkṛtya

Cf. IAC1, p.32: acuram eṉpatu, kollēṟu koṇṭāṉ ivaḷaiyeytum, villēṟṟiṉāṉ ivaḷaiyeytum, tiripiṉṟi eytāṉ ivaḷaiyeytum, mālai cūṭṭappaṭṭāṉ ivaḷaiyeytum iṉṉatoruporuḷ tantāṉ ivaḷai yeytumeṉa ivvāṟu collikkoṭuppatu; aḵtu arumporuḷ viṉainilaiyeṉpatu
Cf. Gaut 4.11: vittenānatiḥ strīmatām āsuraḥ
Cf. IAC1, p.32: irākkatam eṉpatu avaḷ taṉṉiṉun tamariṉum peṟātu valintu koḷvatu
Cf. Gaut 4.12: prasahyādānād rākṣasaḥ
Cf. IAC1, p.32: paicācam eṉpatu mūttāṇmāṭṭun tuyiṉṟāṇmāṭṭuṅ kaḷittāṇmāṭṭuñ cārvatu: atu pēynilaiyeṉappaṭum
Cf. Gaut 4.13: asaṃvijñātopasaṃgamāt paiśācaḥ
Cf. IAC1, p.32: kārntārvam eṉpatu iruvar ottār tāmē kūṭuṅkūṭṭam; ataṉai yāḻōr kūṭṭameṉpatu
Cf. Gaut 4.10: icchantyāḥ svayaṃ saṃyogo gāndharvaḥ
